instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> nand.
threads.message:
Hello everyone, i got this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> macbook pro, and i was wondring if i can change the nand? Also is there any tools needed (to copy data in nand). 
And same for ram is it possible to add ram?

thank you.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> nand.
threads.message:
You can use the NANDs from donor board, same model, as easiest option.
You can also use the NANDs from different board model, if had the same SSD capacity.
Just maintain original position of the chips, when solder in the new board.

To use new NANDs, you must initialize them; P13 programmer has been mentioned several times on the forum.

Consult pages 12 & 93 for RAM and SSD options.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> nand.
threads.message:
Thank you for reply, ok so nand not encrypted with T2? 
I donâ€™t need to copy data for the original nand?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> nand.
threads.message: SSD data is lost, once any NAND chip is bad.
